channel.title: Demonic Swords
channel.description:
I know I don't do primitives, but thats because I've got a tablet for my laptop and I love to draw instead, so stop whining about my wireframes, there's no extra polys. That aside, give me your love/hate and rep XD
Demonic Longsword: [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Demonicsword2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Demonicsword3.png[/img] [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Demonicsword4.png[/img]
Demonic Greatsword: [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Untitled8.png[/img] [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Demonicgsword1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Demonicgsword2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Demonicgsword3.png[/img]

@Fridder wrote:

This models section is kind of cool. How the hell do you people make those models? I get on Metasequoia and make a box. Then I get confused, look up some youtube tutorials… skip through it and come back to mopar, completely forgetting all about the metasequoia stuff. Is there some type of thing I have to use or…?

I’m not going to argue wiht you guys, think what you want, in the end it still doesn’t matter.
[/quote]No, its pretty much exactly the same aside from the pummel Its not bad to go from an image, I’ve done it before too, countless times, nothing to be ashamed of :P[/quote]

I didn’t base it off an image, if I did I would admit it like I have before…

item.title: Demonic Swords
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Okay, you’re obviously lying. How convenient is it that the second image, posted January 13, 2010, matches your sword almost exactly, including every edge of the blade?
They aren’t “very similar”, they’re the same.
Notice how the first sword has a hole in the middle, with two edges going off to both sides, and so does this image.

Literally every physical aspect of the first blade matches the image.

Read full topic

item.title: Demonic Swords
item.dc:creator: @LordDeth LordDeth
item.description:
@LordDeth wrote:

The Wanderer:

Now, you really shouldn’t lie. The chances of making both of those swords that look almost exactly like those images and even are produced with the google search “demonic swords” is highly unlikely. I really do hate liars. And I never said using reference images was a bad thing, as I stated I do the same thing myself. I was just correcting reyx7 in saying you had creativity, as the only thing you changed was you made the blade green and black on the first blade instead of it being steel.

I’m not going to lie to cover my ass in something where it doesn’t matter, Those swords are very similar, but I didn’t copy mine from it, all I did was start drawing out a longsword and added random curves to make it look cool in the blade and the hilt. If I was going to trace the one you posted I would have added the skulls in the hilt that are portrayed in the image, and the metal inlays on the blade. Don’t just assume you’re always right just because it seems like what you think it is. Its very insulting.

Read full topic

item.title: Demonic Swords
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“LordDeth, post:8, topic:408682”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=509964.msg3700331#msg3700331 date=1312709717]
those are some messy wireframes, try to recreate them out of prims
[/quote]

Do you not know how to read before posting? Seriously? I said idc about how messy the wireframe is, I don’t use prims.
Learn to read…

[quote author=gravenfire23 link=topic=509964.msg3701808#msg3701808 date=1312780033]
I dont like the colors on the first sword and the handle looks to smooth.
[/quote][/quote]

Chill, he’s trying to help. In general, primitives > tracing, and you’ll find its a lot easier to use them if/when you transition over. And you really should care how messy your wireframe is, because often times that will make the render look like shit. Keep the wireframes clean, and the model will look a LOT better. You’d be amazed at the difference

Read full topic

item.title: Demonic Swords
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

adrian1372:

They look a bit flat =\ other than that, this is great!

Also, if you are going to trace, at the least use rectangles instead of triangles. That way we can actually critique your model. You will never be able to model anything decent without a good understanding of polygon flow.

The demonic head looks a bit flat on the last sword. Also I see some glitchy faces caused from bad polygon flow.

Also, since you said you use a tablet to model, I suggest you look into sculpting. A free program you can try out is…

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
